intro: Oenothera ignota, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a species of flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its pale yellow to white flowers, which bloom at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant is a member of the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is known for its ability to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments. Oenothera ignota has hairy, linear leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, black seeds. It is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
